page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY} Mr.Ansteys grandchildren have endless choices of leisure pursuits,but when he was a boy his main delight was the boxing matches arranged with the local lads in the fields.Apart from these matches there were games with marbles,bow and arrows,cricket and football.Outings organised by the Parish were enjoyed by all the community.Although Mr.Anstey regrets many changes he appreciates some have been for the better.Mechanisation has made the day to day running of the farm much easier.More generally a change which has affected the lot of the common man greatly the National Health service,is praised by Mr.Anstey Mr.Anstey's intimate knowledge of the area over a number of years gives an invaluable insight into changes that have taken place over the years.
